#Text=Canada 's Etobicoke Centre ( Ward 3 )
#Text=city council candidates speak
#Text=Monday , October 30 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontoians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Etobicoke Centre ( Ward 3 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Doug Holyday ( incumbent ) , Peter Kudryk , Lillian Lança , and Ross Vaughan .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Lillian Lança
#Text=53-year-old Lillian Lança is an Office Assistant , Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics , Faculty of Arts and Science , University of Toronto .
#Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=Ward 3 in Etobicoke Centre , has one of the largest populations of seniors in Canada .
#Text=There are many issues unique to seniors .
#Text=Many seniors are on fixed incomes and are often property rich and cash poor .
#Text=A better method than the present property tax assessment could be explored for collecting tax dollars easing seniors ' financial burdens .
#Text=Some other ideas such as allowing seniors to work part-time without the government clawing back benefits would enable more seniors to remain in their homes .
#Text=An improved TTC system would maintain seniors ' independence .
#Text=Community safety is an issue facing most urban communities , not just ward 3 .
#Text=We need to keep our children in school , off the streets and away from gangs .
#Text=Parks and recreation , and after school programs need to be expanded and more accessible .

#Text=I have learned of mentoring and tutoring initiatives in conjunction with community organizations , businesses and institutes of higher learning that have proven successful in reducing drop-out rates and absenteeism .
#Text=A culture of achievement should be encouraged for our children .
#Text=Keeping our youth in school will turn potential delinquents , criminals and welfare recipients into good citizens who will earn salaries and pay taxes .
#Text=Lastly , there needs to be more fiscal responsibility through better planning with our tax dollars , the money is there .
#Text=Toronto is one of the main engines driving a booming Canadian economy .
#Text=However , our infrastructure is deteriorating while taxes keep increasing .
#Text=This is not good for business .
#Text=Our public services are being eroded while our communities are suffering .
#Text=Upper levels of government have been downloading responsibilities onto municipalities while decreasing funding , without allowing municipalities a voice in the decision-making process .
#Text=This needs to change .
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=While ward 3 , Etobicoke Centre , has one of the oldest populations in Canada , the demographics of this ward are gradually changing .
#Text=Ward 3 is becoming more ethnically diverse particularly with a growing Somali community .
#Text=This ward needs to be ready to accommodate these new Canadians with programs and facilities that will better integrate them into the mosaic that is Canada .

#Text=Housing , English as a Second Language , health care , and so importantly , jobs are only a few of the ingredients needed to enable them to become active participants in making this country great .
